data.title: Countries that use the Danish krone
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Danish krone. Convert DKK to any other currency.
data.text:
The Danish krone was established in 1875 as an official national currency and is used only in Greenland and in Denmark. It replaced the previously valid rigsdaler. 1 Krone is devided into 100 Ã¸re.

Since 2000, the Danish krone is tied to the euro with a fixed exchange rate. Therefore, 1 krone always equals to 0.1340 euro.
